issues.description: The site header contains excessive element clutter with no clear visual separation between navigation items, promotional banners, and utility links. This lack of visual hierarchy makes it difficult for users to quickly identify primary navigation options and key actions.
issues.evidence: Smashing Magazine case study identified header clutter as a significant usability issue affecting first-time visitors.

issues.description: The mobile navigation menu uses confusing category labels and groupings that do not match user mental models. Product categories overlap and the hierarchy is unclear, causing users to struggle to find specific product types on mobile devices.
issues.evidence: Mobile menu structure created confusion about product categorization, with overlapping labels and unclear hierarchy.

issues.description: Users must navigate through complex and deep navigation paths to reach product pages, with multiple intermediate category and subcategory pages. These long navigation paths cause significant drop-offs as users lose patience or orientation.
issues.evidence: Deep navigation requiring 3-4 clicks to reach product pages, with analytics showing drop-offs at each intermediate step.

issues.element: Page load and rendering across site
issues.description: Slow page load times across the site, particularly on product listing and detail pages, directly impact conversion rates. Large unoptimized images and excessive JavaScript contribute to poor Core Web Vitals scores, causing user abandonment.
issues.evidence: Performance audit revealed slow load times impacting conversion, with unoptimized assets and excessive client-side JavaScript.

issues.description: The checkout process contains multiple friction points including excessive form fields, unclear progress indication, and surprise shipping cost reveals late in the flow. These cumulatively create a cumbersome experience that drives cart abandonment.
issues.evidence: Checkout flow analysis revealed high abandonment rates due to form complexity, hidden costs, and unclear progress through purchase steps.
